intro: Melandrium purpureum, commonly known as the purple sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Crambe, which includes several species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and are borne on slender stems. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
